intro: Commelina aspera var. opulens, commonly known as the rough commelina, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, blue-violet flowers that are clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in ecological studies and ornamental horticulture.
